meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a prism.
meanings.sent1: The prismatic light reflected beautifully off the crystal.
meanings.sent2: The artist used prismatic colors to create a stunning painting.
meanings.sent3: The prismatic effect of the glasses made everyone look like they had rainbow faces.
meanings.sent4: Her prismatic personality shone through in every aspect of her life.
meanings.sent5: The prismatic sunset painted the sky in a myriad of hues.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a variety of colors or shapes.
meanings.sent1: The garden was a prismatic display of flowers in every color imaginable.
meanings.sent2: Her prismatic wardrobe always stood out in a crowd.
meanings.sent3: The prismatic cake looked almost too pretty to eat.
meanings.sent4: The prismatic mosaic on the wall was a true work of art.
meanings.sent5: The prismatic fireworks lit up the night sky in a dazzling spectacle.

meanings.definition: Having the form of a prism.
meanings.sent1: The prismatic crystal was carefully cut to catch the light.
meanings.sent2: The chandelier had a prismatic design that scattered light in all directions.
meanings.sent3: The prismatic sculpture seemed to change shape as you walked around it.
meanings.sent4: Her prismatic glasses made everything look like it was in a funhouse mirror.
meanings.sent5: The prismatic architecture of the building made it a landmark in the city.
